programme.title: Running Wild
programme.desc: A retired Air Force Major (Gregory Harrison), now a UN observer for the International Wildlife Organization, and his children confront elephant poachers in Zimbabwe. Simon MacCorkindale, Cody Jones and Brooke Nevin costar.(n)

programme.title: Mrs McCutcheon
programme.desc: Having always felt he was born in the wrong body, 10-year-old Tom chooses the name Mrs McCutcheon rather than the name he was given at birth; he also prefers the flow of a dress rather than the cut of a pant. Now at his third school, Tom is having trouble settling in and finding acceptance from his newfound peers - except for Trevor, a tough little charmer who also suffers prejudice due to his Aboriginal heritage.(n)

programme.title: Skateboarding's First Wave
programme.desc: Documentary from Academy Award® nominee Don Burgess exploring the origins of skateboarding culture, through the lens of the 1965 Palisades Skateboard Team, who reinvented a childhood hobby into a sport, bringing it to the vanguard of popular culture. Features interviews with the team members reflecting on how the sport has changed, 50 years later.(n)

programme.title: Jurassic School
programme.desc: Nerdy middle schooler Tommy is forced take care of a baby dinosaur after his cloned science fair project hatches early. He quickly begins to think of the creature not only as a pet, but also as a friend. But when the dinosaur escapes on the day of the fair, Tommy must figure out a way to get the creature back before greedy grown-ups get to him first.(n)

programme.title: Christmas Ranch
programme.desc: When a rebellious young girl is sent to stay on her grandmother's ranch for Christmas, a friendship with a pony alters the course of her life but when the ranch is threatened with foreclosure she must come up with a plan to save horse and home.(n)

programme.title: Christmas Eve
programme.desc: In this all-star family comedy, a power outage traps six groups of New Yorkers in elevators on Christmas Eve where they find that laughter, romance and a little bit of faith might get them through – and change their lives in unexpected ways. Stars Patrick Stewart and Jon Heder.(n)

programme.title: Who Gets the Dog?
programme.desc: After deciding to call their marriage quits, Olive (Alicia Silverstone) and Clay (Ryan Kwanten) both want custody of their beloved dog Wesley. Facing a court-ordered 60-day review to determine who'll get the pooch, Olive and Clay try their doggone best to win over the judge in this romantic comedy about what happens when puppy love goes to the dogs.(n)

programme.title: All-Stars
programme.desc: Comedy about a veteran softball coach, who is saddled with a team of inexperienced 10-year-old girls and their overly ambitious, delusional parents.(n)

programme.title: Running Wild
programme.desc: A retired Air Force Major (Gregory Harrison), now a UN observer for the International Wildlife Organization, and his children confront elephant poachers in Zimbabwe. Simon MacCorkindale, Cody Jones and Brooke Nevin costar.(n)

programme.title: New Wave: Dare to be Different
programme.desc: In August, 1982, a small group of radio visionaries at WLIR Long Island knew they couldn't compete with the mega radio stations in New York City. With one brave decision, they changed the sound of radio forever. Program Director Denis McNamara, the crew at the station and the biggest artists of the era tell the story of how they battled the FCC, the record labels, mega-radio and all the conventional rules to create a musical movement that brought the New Wave to America - including bands like U2, Talking Heads, Depeche Mode and Blondie.(n)

programme.title: The Sense of an Ending
programme.desc: Tony Webster (Jim Broadbent) lives a reclusive existence in London, until he learns that a diary has been left to him by the recently deceased mother (Emily Mortimer) of an ex-girlfriend (Charlotte Rampling). As Webster investigates the diary, he is forced to face the truth about his first love and the consequences of decisions made a lifetime ago, while attempting to resolve his strained relationships with his ex-wife (Harriet Walter) and their pregnant daughter (Michelle Dockery).

Joel and Tess secure Charlie behind bars in the cellar after thwarting his second escape attempt. Paranoia convinces Joel that Detective Talbot is following him after an unexpected visit to Kira's and that the net is closing in.

credits.director: Adult Content, Adult Language, Brief Nudity

programme.desc: Tess tells an out of control Joel to get a grip and focus on why they're there: to cure Charlie. In his hungover state, however, Joel smashes the final dose of chemo and their attempt to secure more tips off the police. Season finale.(c)

credits.director: Adult Content, Adult Language, Mild Violence

programme.title: Terms of Endearment
programme.desc: Hard-to-please Aurora (Shirley MacLaine) is looking for love, while her daughter (Debra Winger) has her own set of family problems. Also starring Jack Nicholson.

programme.title: SXSW Comedy with Natasha Leggero Part 2
programme.desc: Actress and comedian Natasha Leggero hosts an all-star lineup of the most hilarious minds in comedy, including Emo Phillips, Sean Patton, Ian Edwards, Kurt Braunohler and Eliza Skinner.

programme.title: Black Christmas (1974)
programme.desc: Classic slasher film in which a group of sorority sisters are stalked by an unwelcome guest during the Christmas break.

programme.title: Against the Current
programme.desc: Justin Kirk and Joseph Fiennes star in this independent drama about a middle-aged man who decides to fulfill a childhood dream of swimming 150 miles of the Hudson River with his best friend rowing alongside for encouragement, but a bittersweet hidden agenda for the feat is gradually revealed. Mary Tyler Moore costars.

programme.title: Collide
programme.desc: Casey, a young American backpacker in Germany, falls in love with Juliette, a fellow American traveling through Europe. She is diagnosed with a fatal disease, and Casey decides to steal from German gangster Hagen, in order to pay for the medical treatment which could save Juliette's life. Casey's heist doesn't go as planned and Hagen catches him. He manages to escape Hagen's men, steal one of Hagen's cars, and flee. Pursued across Germany, he races to save his own life and get to Juliette before Hagen's men get to her first.

programme.title: Mona Lisa Smile
programme.desc: In 1953, a time when women's roles are rigidly defined, novice art history professor Katherine Watson begins teaching at the prestigious all-female Wellesley College, which despite its academic reputation, is an environment where success is measured by how well the students marry. Encouraging these women to strive for a more enlightened future, Watson challenges the administration and inspires her students to look beyond the image of what is, and consider the possibilities of what could be.

programme.title: I, Daniel Blake
programme.desc: Daniel Blake (Dave Johns) is a man out of time. He's a widowed woodworker who's never owned a computer and lives according to his own common sense moral code. After a heart attack leaves him unable to work and the state welfare system fails him, Daniel must stand up and fight for his dignity and lead a one-man crusade for compassion that transforms the lives of a single mother (Hayley Squires) and her two children.

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: A wedding is about to take place in Chinquapin, Louisiana. The bride is Shelby (Julia Roberts), a headstrong young beauty whose iron-willed mother, M'Lynn (Sally Field), would do anything for her. Giant-haired Dolly Parton is Truvy, the owner of the beauty parlor that serves as the town's unofficial hub. Dropping in to exchange gossip are Ouiser (Shirley MacLaine), the richest and meanest woman in town, and Clairee (Olympia Dukakis), an elegant widow with a sly delivery. Together they provide each other with strength and friendship.

programme.title: The Fantasticks
programme.desc: Joel Grey and Brad Sullivan are small-town fathers conspiring to bring their children together in a love match by pretending to discourage it in this magical musical costarring Barnard Hughes.

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: In the early 1980s, Charlie Wilson is a womanizing US congressional representative from Texas who is a member of two major foreign policy and covert-ops committees. After being prodded by his major conservative supporter, Houston Socialite Joanne Herring, Wilson learns about the plight the people are suffering in the brutal Soviet occupation of Afghanistan. With the help of maverick CIA agent Gustav Avrakotos, Wilson dedicates his canny political efforts to supply the Afghan mujahideen with the weapons and support to defeat the Soviet Union.

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: A wedding is about to take place in Chinquapin, Louisiana. The bride is Shelby (Julia Roberts), a headstrong young beauty whose iron-willed mother, M'Lynn (Sally Field), would do anything for her. Giant-haired Dolly Parton is Truvy, the owner of the beauty parlor that serves as the town's unofficial hub. Dropping in to exchange gossip are Ouiser (Shirley MacLaine), the richest and meanest woman in town, and Clairee (Olympia Dukakis), an elegant widow with a sly delivery. Together they provide each other with strength and friendship.

programme.title: Mona Lisa Smile
programme.desc: In 1953, a time when women's roles are rigidly defined, novice art history professor Katherine Watson begins teaching at the prestigious all-female Wellesley College, which despite its academic reputation, is an environment where success is measured by how well the students marry. Encouraging these women to strive for a more enlightened future, Watson challenges the administration and inspires her students to look beyond the image of what is, and consider the possibilities of what could be.

programme.title: Children of Men
programme.desc: This sci-fi epic envisions a future world that has fallen into anarchy on the heels of an infertility defect in the population that has made humankind face the likelihood of its own extinction. Set against a backdrop of London torn apart by violence, the film follows one of the champions of Earth's survival: Theo (Academy Award nominee Clive Owen), a disillusioned ex-activist turned bureaucrat, who faces his own demons and must protect the planet's last remaining hope for a future generation.

programme.title: Body of Deceit
programme.desc: Alice (Kristanna Loken) is a ghostwriter for a famous author. She is halfway through the work of his new book, but cannot write anymore. A year has passed since she had a terrible accident in Malta where she was staying with her husband Max (Antonio Cupo) in his family villa and was in a coma for two weeks. Since then, she has been suffering from depression and has recurrent and cryptic nightmares. Max persuades her to go back to Malta in the hopes that something will unblock her mind so she can start working again and meet her deadline.

programme.title: Lady Psycho Killer
programme.desc: A knife-wielding killer is on the loose in a small town slicing and dicing men of questionable intent. As her brutality leaves the town littered with corpses, her bloodlust is lost on her young lover who pursues her anyway.

programme.title: Mona Lisa Smile
programme.desc: In 1953, a time when women's roles are rigidly defined, novice art history professor Katherine Watson begins teaching at the prestigious all-female Wellesley College, which despite its academic reputation, is an environment where success is measured by how well the students marry. Encouraging these women to strive for a more enlightened future, Watson challenges the administration and inspires her students to look beyond the image of what is, and consider the possibilities of what could be.

programme.title: My First Mister
programme.desc: Jennifer (Leelee Sobieski) is a 17-year-old Goth with multiple face-piercings and a fondness for graveyards. Randall (Albert Brooks) is a middle-aged salesman with an obsessively tidy life and a fear of anything new. Desperate to escape her world, Jennifer impulsively applies for a job at Randall's conservative clothing store. Soon, an unlikely friendship blooms. But even as Randall attempts to show Jennifer the possibilities of her own future, Jennifer discovers the extraordinary secret haunting Randall's past.

programme.title: My One and Only
programme.desc: After she catches her husband cheating on her, a charming, flamboyant socialite packs her two young sons into a Coupe de Ville and embarks on a cross-country journey to find a new head of the family. Renee Zellweger, Logan Lerman and Kevin Bacon star in this comedy-drama loosely based on a true story.

programme.title: Fair Game (2010)
programme.desc: The real-life scandal involving the public exposure of Valerie Plame as an undercover CIA agent by vindictive White House officials determined to punish her husband Joe Wilson for his political views is recounted in this drama starring Naomi Watts, Sean Penn and Sam Shepard.

programme.title: The Light Between Oceans
programme.desc: Lighthouse keeper Tom Sherbourne (Michael Fassbender) and spirited Isabel (Alicia Vikander) live together in married bliss on a remote, rugged island off the coast of Australia. But their windswept world is turned upside down when Isabel learns that she's unable to bear a child. One day, a drifting lifeboat washes ashore with a crying baby in it. The dilemma the couple now faces echoes far beyond the island, engulfing and irrevocably impacting their world.

programme.title: The Edge of Seventeen
programme.desc: Nadine (Hailee Steinfeld) and Krista (Haley Lu Richardson) are inseparable best friends attempting to navigate high school together, until Nadine's older brother Darian (Blake Jenner) and Krista begin dating. With her view of the world rocked, Nadine is forced to see the people in her life, including her well-meaning but distracted mother (Kyra Sedgwick), and unlikely mentor and History teacher Mr. Bruner (Woody Harrelson), with fresh eyes and new appreciation. She realizes that people - and life - are more complicated than she thought.

programme.title: The Weather Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage stars in this comedy-drama as a Chicago weather man whose personal life enters free-fall even as his career is potentially about to take off with a new job on a national television morning show. Michael Caine and Hope Davis costar in this film from director Gore Verbinski ("The Ring," "Pirates of the Caribbean").

programme.title: Mistrust
programme.desc: Happy, beautiful and independent, Veronica enjoys being a mistress. No commitment, no strings and she never has to be vulnerable. She has carefully laid every brick in the walls of the fortress surrounding her heart. She's safe and having a great time. However, there is one person who knew her heart before those walls were erected, her best friend Brandon, who has stood by her for too many years to count. And while Veronica has tried to keep her feelings at bay, he is the one who holds the key that opens her Pandora's box of emotions.

programme.title: Single White Female
programme.desc: Hedy (Jennifer Jason Leigh) appears at the apartment of Allie (Bridget Fonda) just as she has thrown out her unfaithful boyfriend (Steven Weber). The surviving half of a set of twins, Hedy perpetually seeks someone to complete her, and sees in Allie everything she would like to be. Hedy moves not only into the apartment, but into the most personal aspects of Allie's life, including having her hair styled exactly to match her roommate's. When Allie reconciles with her boyfriend, the unspoken bargain between the women goes terrifyingly awry.(n)

programme.title: Single White Female 2: The Psycho
programme.desc: When Holly Parker (Kristen Miller) moves into her new apartment, she thinks she has found the perfect roommate: Tess Kositch (Allison Lange), a sweet and shy young woman who wants to be her friend. But underneath Tess' shy exterior lies a killer who believes there is nothing sweeter in life than murdering a friend in pain. And Holly is feeling a lot of pain lately, what with her boyfriend cheating on her and her co-worker undermining any chance she has for promotion. But Holly need not worry, Tess will take care of her.(n)

programme.title: Life During Wartime
programme.desc: One sister is a bitter screenwriter, another meets an older man she hopes will give structure to her disordered life, and a third must deal with a child-molesting ex-husband who has been paroled from jail and wants to reconcile with their son. Allison Janney, Ally Sheedy and Shirley Henderson star in this dysfunctional family drama from director Todd Solondz, a sequel to his earlier film "Happiness" that casts new actors in the same roles.(n)

programme.title: TIFFANY HADDISH: SHE READY! From the Hood to Hollywood!
programme.desc: In this hour-long special filmed at the Nate Holden Performing Arts Center, rising comedy star Tiffany Haddish takes the stage in her hometown of Los Angeles to tackle subjects ranging from her early days in foster care and being bullied on the playground, to getting her revenge on ex-boyfriends and introducing Will and Jada Pinkett Smith to Groupon.(n)

programme.title: An Eye For Beauty
programme.desc: Luc is a brilliant young architect with a budding reputation. Opinionated, charming and confident, he lives with his beautiful wife in the stunning countryside of Quebec. Luc's seemingly perfect life begins to fall apart, however, when he meets and falls for a mysterious woman during a business trip. Caught in a triangle of emotions, he puts everything in jeopardy to pursue his affair, including the life he has built and the woman he loves.(n)

programme.title: Mistrust
programme.desc: Happy, beautiful and independent, Veronica enjoys being a mistress. No commitment, no strings and she never has to be vulnerable. She has carefully laid every brick in the walls of the fortress surrounding her heart. She's safe and having a great time. However, there is one person who knew her heart before those walls were erected, her best friend Brandon, who has stood by her for too many years to count. And while Veronica has tried to keep her feelings at bay, he is the one who holds the key that opens her Pandora's box of emotions.(n)

programme.title: Devil's Pass
programme.desc: Nine Russian hikers venture into a remote area of the Ural Mountains. Two weeks later, all nine are found dead. Five ambitious American college students are issued a grant to return to the site of the original events in the belief that they can uncover and document the truth of what happened. Their trek through the mountains, retracing the steps of that ill-fated journey, is plagued by strange and increasingly terrifying phenomena, all of which suggest that they are not alone. The forces behind the Dyatlov Pass Incident are waiting for them.(n)

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Pop music sensation Britney Spears stars in this teen road-trip drama about a trio of high school pals that heads for the bright lights of Los Angeles, meeting up with both romance and loss along the way. Zoe Saldana, Taryn Manning, Anson Mount, Dan Aykroyd and Kim Cattrall costar in this film from director Tamra Davis ("Billy Madison").(n)

programme.title: Last Night
programme.desc: Michael and Joanna Reed (Sam Worthington and Keira Knightley) seem to have it all. Young, attractive and successful, they're a married couple who've lucked into spiritual and material well-being, sharing a comfortable life in their trendy Manhattan apartment. But when they attend one of Michael's work parties, Joanna witnesses a suspicious moment between her husband and his beautiful new co-worker, Laura (Eva Mendes). Joanna can't be sure what she did or didn't see - but it sows a powerful seed of doubt.(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Just when Bridget thinks life is perfect, her relationship with the dreamy Mark Darcy implodes. She sets off on a whirlwind business trip to Thailand where she encounters old flame Daniel Cleaver, and her life gets out-of-control.(n)

programme.title: Sidewalks of New York
programme.desc: After sharing the stories of their earliest sexual experiences with an interviewer, six people are trailed by a cameraman through the course of an average day. Tommy (Edward Burns) is a successful television producer (and unsuccessful novelist) who becomes quickly infatuated when he meets Maria (Rosario Dawson) in a video store. Maria is a teacher who has just gotten out of a bad marriage with Ben (David Krumholtz), a struggling musician with a day job as a doorman. Ben, on the other hand, finds himself attracted to Ashley (Brittany Murphy).(n)

programme.title: The Truth About Lies
programme.desc: Gilby Smalls (Fran Kranz) is having a meltdown. He's just been fired from his job and his girlfriend gave him the boot. Forced to move in with May (Coleen Camp), his booze-swilling man-obsessed mother, he's desperate to turn things around. Gilby's luck seems to change when he meets Rachel (Odette Annable), the very thing Gilby needs to get his life back on track. Desperate to impress her, Gilby starts to weave a web of lies; one bigger than the next. Now in a sticky mess, Gilby is forced to face the uncomfortable truth about himself.(n)

programme.title: Wakefield
programme.desc: Successful suburbanite commuter Howard Wakefield (Bryan Cranston) takes a perverse detour from family life by vanishing without a trace. Hidden in the attic of his carriage house garage and surviving by scavenging at night, Howard secretly observes the lives of his wife (Jennifer Garner) and children and neighbors. He slowly realizes that he has not left his family, he has left himself.(n)

programme.title: Last Night
programme.desc: Michael and Joanna Reed (Sam Worthington and Keira Knightley) seem to have it all. Young, attractive and successful, they're a married couple who've lucked into spiritual and material well-being, sharing a comfortable life in their trendy Manhattan apartment. But when they attend one of Michael's work parties, Joanna witnesses a suspicious moment between her husband and his beautiful new co-worker, Laura (Eva Mendes). Joanna can't be sure what she did or didn't see - but it sows a powerful seed of doubt.(n)

programme.title: The Loneliness of the Long Distance Runner
programme.desc: A rebellious working-class youth sent to a reformatory finds clarity of purpose during long, purifying runs in training for an important race against a posh rival school.

programme.title: King and Country
programme.desc: The court-martial of a British soldier during World War I. A cogent plea for justice. Excellent performances and direction (Joseph Losey). Tom Courtenay. Hargreaves: Dirk Bogarde. O'Sullivan: Leo McKern. Webb: Barry Foster.

programme.title: The Night of the Generals
programme.desc: Tale of Nazi Germany, with Peter O'Toole as a psychotic general suspected of a sex murder. Grau: Omar Sharif. Hartmann: Tom Courtenay. Ulrike: Joanna Pettet. Morand: Philippe Noiret. Kahlenberge: Donald Pleasence. Rommel: Christopher Plummer. Von Seidlitz-Gabler: Charles Gray. Eleanore: Coral Browne. Sandauer: John Gregson. Otto: Nigel Stock. Juliette: Juliette Greco. Well-produced but languid; disappointing.

programme.title: Eyes of Laura Mars
programme.desc: An intense and driven fashion photographer, who has made a name for herself by juxtaposing sex and violence in her glamorous photos, is haunted by psychic premonitions of a serial killer who is murdering her friends and colleagues.

programme.title: Coma
programme.desc: A female doctor turns detective to unearth a deadly conspiracy involving harvesting organs at the hospital where she is performing her residency.

programme.title: The White Angel
programme.desc: A study of the life of English nurse Florence Nightingale, who became renowned for her dedication to improve poor hospital conditions in the Victorian era.

programme.title: So You're Going to Be a Father
programme.desc: A man (George O'Hanlon) becomes a nervous wreck when he learns his wife is going to have a baby in this “Joe McDoakes” comedy short. Directed by Richard L. Bare.

programme.title: How I Play Golf by Bobby Jones No. 8 The Brassie *
programme.desc: (cc).

programme.title: Papa Gets the Bird *
programme.desc: (cc).

programme.title: Freighters of Destiny
programme.desc: A wagon train transports a group of settlers. Tom Keene, Barbara Kent and Slim Whitacker. Directed by Fred Allen.

programme.title: Tailspin Tommy in the Great Air Mystery Wreck of the Dirigible *
programme.desc: (cc).

programme.title: Tarzan and the Slave Girl
programme.desc: The ape man organizes a safari to rescue native girls held by fugitive tribesmen. Lex Barker, Vanessa Brown, Robert Alda, Denise Darcel. Prince: Hurd Hatfield. Lee Sholem directed.

programme.title: Nertsery Rhymes
programme.desc: Musical-comedy short featuring the Three Stooges as children who request bedtime stories from their top-hatted father (Ted Healy), who is joined in the telling by a good fairy (Bonnie Bonnell).

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: David Lean's epic won seven Oscars, including Best Picture and Best Actor for Alec Guinness as the leader of British POWs forced to build a railroad bridge in World War II Indochina. Filmed in Ceylon (Sri Lanka). Oscar-winning screenplay by Carl Foreman.

programme.title: The Sundowners
programme.desc: In 1920s Australia, a sheep drover who loves his nomadic life attempts to settle down for his wife and child, but he chafes at the responsibilities that come with owning a farm.

programme.title: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's classic sci-fi tale about two ordinary Midwesterners who are transformed by extraordinary chance meetings with visitors from outer space. Vilmos Zsigmond won an Oscar for his dazzling cinematography.

programme.title: Jeremiah Johnson
programme.desc: A Rocky Mountain trapper assimilates with Native Americans in the 1820s, but becomes a legendary Indian killer after the Crow tribe kills his family in retaliation for leading the U.S. cavalry on a rescue mission through a sacred burial site.

programme.title: Man in the Wilderness
programme.desc: Richard Harris as a trapper on a 600-mile quest for the men who left him to die. John Huston. Indian Chief: Henry Wilcoxon. Fogarty: Percy Herbert. Lowrie: Dennis Waterman. Grace: Prunella Ransome. Ferris: Norman Rossington. Richard C. Sarafian directed.

programme.title: Pitfall
programme.desc: A married, successful insurance man falls for an attractive client and soon meets trouble in the form of a spurned suitor.

programme.title: Your Cheatin' Heart
programme.desc: Biography of legendary country singer Hank Williams Sr. charts his short life through his guitar-strumming boyhood, his meteoric rise to fame with the hit title song, his appearances at the Grand Ole Opry and his subsequent battles with the bottle, to his death at age 29. Star George Hamilton's singing is dubbed by a 15-year-old Hank Williams Jr.

programme.title: Honeysuckle Rose
programme.desc: Music sweetens this story of a singer (Willie Nelson) involved with two women (Dyan Cannon, Amy Irving). Slim Pickens. Jamie: Joey Floyd. Sid: Charles Levin. Directed by Jerry Schatzberg.

programme.title: Judge Hardy and Son
programme.desc: A small-town judge with a good heart tries to save an elderly couple from their impending eviction, all while simultaneously coping with his wife being sick.

programme.title: Too Much, Too Soon
programme.desc: Superficial account of Diana Barrymore's life and work. Dorothy Malone, Errol Flynn, Efrem Zimbalist Jr., Ray Danton. Based on the autobiography. Art Napoleon directed.

programme.title: Pitfall
programme.desc: A married, successful insurance man falls for an attractive client and soon meets trouble in the form of a spurned suitor.

programme.title: Father of the Bride
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee is a comedy of manners concerning a harried middle-class lawyer who frets over the work, expense and frenzy surrounding the engagement and wedding of his precious daughter. Spencer Tracy, in the title role, was nominated for Best Actor. The film spawned the 1951 sequel, "Father's Little Dividend," and was remade in 1991 with Steve Martin as the Dad.

programme.title: Father's Little Dividend
programme.desc: The sequel to "Father of the Bride" picks up with the newly married young lady giving birth to a boy, who screams his head off every time his grandfather comes near him. Spencer Tracy, Joan Bennett and Elizabeth Taylor reprise their roles from the original, with Vincente Minnelli once again doing the directing.

programme.title: The Entertainer
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier is brilliant in John Osborne's play about a vaudevillian whose ego has helped him survive a life of failure. Phoebe: Brenda de Banzie. Frank: Alan Bates. Jean: Joan Plowright. Tina: Shirley Ann Field. Billy: Roger Livesey. Graham: Daniel Massey. Mick: Albert Finney. Directed by Tony Richardson. (cc).

programme.title: Death of a Salesman
programme.desc: An aging door-to-door salesman loses his job and begins to contemplate suicide. He also faces up to some uncomfortable truths about his son.

programme.title: The Courtship of Eddie's Father
programme.desc: A young son thinks it's about time for his widowed father to start dating again, but he's not happy about dad's choices in women. So the lad takes matters into his own hands and tries to fix up his father with the attractive next-door neighbor. The film spawned a popular TV series (1969-72).(n)

programme.title: Life With Father
programme.desc: An 1880s New York financier runs a tight ship, but his wife is really the captain, especially when she realizes that he is not baptized.(n)

programme.title: An Eastern Westerner
programme.desc: The father of a spoiled young New Yorker ships him out West to a ranch, where he hopes the lad will toughen up and learn a bit of responsibility. Once there, he squares off against a town bully and falls for a local belle.(n)

programme.title: High and Dizzy
programme.desc: In this silent comedy, Harold Lloyd stars as a novice doctor lacking patients, but finding one, and a love interest, in a young woman with a sleepwalking problem that lands both her and an inebriated Lloyd, on a ledge high atop a building. The object of his affection is played by Lloyd's future wife, Mildred Davis. Lloyd's real-life brother, Gaylord Lloyd, costars.(n)

programme.title: Number, Please
programme.desc: A forger develops a yen for telephone switchboard girl Mabel Poulton.(n)

programme.title: Get Out and Get Under
programme.desc: A young actor oversleeps and runs into a string of disasters while racing to get to the theater on time.(n)

programme.title: Tokyo Drifter
programme.desc: Stylish tale about a hit man on the outs with his gang, whose former boss has hired assassins to wipe him out. Watari Tetsuya, Matsubara Chieko, Nitani Hideaki. Directed by Seijun Suzuki.(n)

programme.title: Fighting Elegy
programme.desc: Director Seijun Suzuki's stark look at the consequences of idealism, focusing on the coming of age of a teen who turns to fascism to forget his unrequited love for a girl. Hideki Takahashi, Mitsuo Kataoka, Junko Asano, Yusuke Kawazu.(n)

programme.title: Rock Rock Rock!
programme.desc: Desperate to go to a rock and roll dance, a teenage girl tries everything she can to raise money for a new dress to wear.(n)

programme.title: The Cool Ones
programme.desc: A pop star trying to revive his sagging career and an up-and-coming singer are thrown together in a publicity stunt by their manager and wind up falling in love.(n)

programme.title: Muscle Beach Party
programme.desc: Surfers feel threatened when a bunch of well-oiled weightlifters invade their turf on the beach.(n)

programme.title: The Wasp Woman
programme.desc: A rejuvenating beauty treatment made from insect enzymes has unexpected side effects for an aging and vain cosmetics executive, who demanded to be the test subject for the new product.(n)

programme.title: Wild, Wild Planet
programme.desc: Thriller about the rulers of two planetary systems who fight for control of the universe. Tony Russell, Lisa Gastoni. Nurmi: Massimo Serato. Jake: Franco Nero. Ken: Carlo Giustini.(n)

programme.title: From Hell It Came
programme.desc: Wooden acting marks this lumbering tale about a monster tree stump whose bite is worse than its bark. Tod Andrews, Tina Carver, Gregg Palmer. Mrs. Kilgore: Linda Watkins. Directed by Dan Milner.(n)

programme.title: Teenagers on Trial
programme.desc: This 1955 short examines juvenile delinquency, positing reasons for the problem and offering possible solutions. Narrated by Bob Hite.(n)

programme.title: Untamed Youth
programme.desc: Rock n' roll "women in prison" drama about two hitchhiking sisters who are sentenced to forced labor on a crooked cotton farm in the Deep South.(n)

programme.title: Devotion
programme.desc: While his wife is away, a barrister (Leslie Howard) falls in love with his son's governess (Ann Harding). Harrington: Robert Williams. Mortimer: O.P. Heggie. Mrs. Mortimer: Louise Closser Hale. Coggins: Dudley Digges. Mrs. Coggins: Alison Skipworth. Margaret: Ruth Weston. Directed by Robert Milton.(n)

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?
programme.desc: A relaxing vacation for eight friends takes an odd turn when Sheila discovers that her ex-husband has followed them and wants to break up her new marriage in this sequel to "Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married?" (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Claws
programme.desc: In the Season 2 premiere, Desna and the girls struggle to keep their hope alive while still working under the thumb of the new Russian regime, spearheaded by Riva. A blissful Desna remains in the dark about her gangster-gyno boyfriend, Ruval. Virginia tells Dean that she's pregnant with his baby. A newly domesticated Polly is jubilant when tasked with being a madam for an all-male dance troupe. Meanwhile, a depressed Uncle Daddy is still reeling from the loss of his beloved Juanda. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Arrow
programme.desc: Oliver tries to track down Thea in Corto Maltese as Diggle searches for a missing field operative. Meanwhile, Felicity adapts to her new job. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Arrow
programme.desc: Oliver and Nyssa join forces and go after the Dark Archer in order to bring Sara's killer to justice. Meanwhile, Laurel keeps her distance from Nyssa because she blames her sister's death on the League of Assassins; and Oliver and Roy work on repairing their respective relationships with Thea. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan identifies the remains of a Jane Doe as belonging to her mother, who went missing along with Brennan's dad 15 years ago. programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the daring daylight kidnapping of a diamond dealer that left two fatalities at the scene. Bernard Powell Sr.: John Cullum. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the death of a woman who had a rent-controlled apartment that blocked the sale of her apartment building. Martha Taylor: Linda Thorson. programme.desc: A Hollywood hooker signs on for a weeklong job with a john who is a corporate raider; he pays for a makeover so she can act as his "date." (cc).

programme.desc: The team helps a 23-year-old trans-woman from Scotland discover her own feminine style. Plus, a woman from Watford is fed up of her friends comparing her to an EastEnders character.

programme.title: In Therapy
programme.desc: The former Big Brother contestant, famous for her crazy outbursts, temper tantrums and `Who is she?' catchphrase, undergoes a series of intensive on-camera therapy sessions with psychotherapist Mandy Saligari. She is keen to leave behind her childlike persona for which she has become known, but to do this she must confront her demons, touching on her battles with anorexia and depression, and the time she was admitted to a psychiatric unit at an early age.

programme.title: Celebrity Botched Up Bodies
programme.desc: After a breast operation, reality TV star Natalee Harris was unhappy with the size, shape and symmetry - and to make matters worse, it left her suffering constant back pain. Now she visits a surgeon to see if he can give her a new more perky pair. The film also meets former page three model Tracy Kirby, who was left scarred both physically and emotionally by an unsuccessful facelift, and 21-year-old Katie Price wannabe Nathan Thursfield, who has spent £40,000 to look like his idol. Plus, a comparison of actor John Travolta as he looked in his 20s with how he appears now as a 62-year-old movie veteran.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia

programme.title: Ranking Jankesa
programme.desc: Krzysztof "Jankes" Jankowski przedstawia subiektywny ranking tego, co najlepsze w sieci, muzyce, świecie show-biznesu i wszystkich innych interesujących rzeczy, którymi dzieli się z widzami.

programme.title: Mobmania
programme.desc: Program o nowinkach technicznych. Autorzy przedstawiają najnowsze gadżety, smartfony itp.

programme.title: Będę grał w grę
programme.desc: Magazyn skierowany do miłośników gier komputerowych. Jego autorzy omawiają i testują najnowsze propozycje, które trafiają na rynek.

programme.title: Miejska lista
programme.desc: Prowadząca program, Ola, odwiedza polskie miasta i zachęca ludzi, by wybierali klipy, które chcieliby usłyszeć.

programme.title: Weekend z Eską TV
programme.desc: Autorzy programu zabierają widzów do najciekawszych miejsc w Polsce. Przeprowadzają wywiady, pokazują kulisy swojej pracy, relacjonują wydarzenia, którym towarzyszyły kamery Eski TV.

programme.title: Jazdy Gwiazdy
programme.desc: Gospodarz programu Filip "Rudy" Rudanacja zaprasza do swojego garbusa znane i lubiane gwiazdy show-biznesu. Podczas wspólnej przejażdżki nie zawaha się zapytać swojego gościa o wszystko, na co ma ochotę i co chcieliby usłyszeć widzowie.

programme.title: 10 hitów 1 po 2

programme.title: Bywanie na dywanie
programme.desc: Paulina Koziejowska i Aleksandra Kot zagłębiają się w świat przemysłu rozrywkowego. Opowiadają o bieżących wydarzeniach z show-biznesu, najświeższych plotkach oraz najgłośniejszych skandalach. Stałymi gośćmi programu są Adrian Nychnerewicz, redaktor "Super Expressu", który podzieli się najnowszymi wieściami z czerwonego dywanu, oraz Michał Kozłowski z Nowa TV, który zdradzi sekrety gwiazd sportu. Widzowie znają już obie gospodynie programu jako prezenterki prognozy pogody na Nowej TV, oprócz tego Aleksandra Kot od kilku lat jest związana ze stacją Eska TV.

programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.(n)

programme.title: Ranking Jankesa

programme.title: Mobmania
programme.desc: Program o nowinkach technicznych. Autorzy przedstawiają najnowsze gadżety, smartfony itp.

programme.title: Bywanie na dywanie
programme.desc: Paulina Koziejowska i Aleksandra Kot zagłębiają się w świat przemysłu rozrywkowego. Opowiadają o bieżących wydarzeniach z show-biznesu, najświeższych plotkach oraz najgłośniejszych skandalach. Stałymi gośćmi programu są Adrian Nychnerewicz, redaktor "Super Expressu", który podzieli się najnowszymi wieściami z czerwonego dywanu, oraz Michał Kozłowski z Nowa TV, który zdradzi sekrety gwiazd sportu. Widzowie znają już obie gospodynie programu jako prezenterki prognozy pogody na Nowej TV, oprócz tego Aleksandra Kot od kilku lat jest związana ze stacją Eska TV.

Players must not forget the loo rolls for Toilet Takedown, boxing gloves for The Unboxing Match or to hop on one leg while shouting 'David Beckham' in a heated game of Do Wear Shout. programme.desc: The Twirlywoos are beside a river. They watch a fisherman make his rod longer and longer and longer. The fisherman casts out the line and then settles down for a nap. Chickedy and Chick run along the rod to the very end. Toodloo runs along the rod and jumps to join Chickedy and Chick. This causes the rod to spring up sending them flying! The fisherman wakes to discover a long, long, long fish at the end of his line. The Twirlywoo Screen draws a small line that Chickedy and Chick help make longer. Toodloo helps the line get a little longer still but when Great BigHoo taps the screen, the line becomes so long it shoots off the Twirlywoo Screen.
